import React from "react"; import {BadgeCheckIcon, ChipIcon} from "@heroicons/react/solid"; export default function Project0(){ const s0 = [ "UV Lithography", "E-beam", "PhotoMask Design", "Reactive Ion Etching", "Clean Room", "Sputtering", "Si Etching", ]; return(

Clean Room Experimentation + Training

Description

  • Trained on the most widely used clean-room equipment for fabrication of a transparent optical sensor.
  • Mentored other graduate students introducing them to MEMS equipment and their working principles

    • Lithography

  • Fabrication via UV I-line lithograhy for making micrometer optical waveguides.
    • --------------Optimizing the process steps namely--------------
  • Spin-coating
  • Edgebead Removal
  • Soft-Bake and Post-Bake
  • Photoresist Development

    • Summary

  • In conclusion, we design and evaluate a thin, flexible, transparent and light optical sensor for triaxial force.

    • Mono-Layer Fabrication

  • To create anti-reflection surface, ... was used when fabricating the
  • Application of force causes in the tactor to contact the waveguides resulting in scattering of light.
  • The materials chosen are flexible and soft to allow for integration on HRI systems such as curved boundaries.
  • The design parameters such as the bending radius of the waveguides, the spacing b/w the waveguides and the thickness of the tactor has been chosen based on COMSOL simulations.

    • {/*mx-auto centers the container */}
    {/*margin-bottom*/}

    {/* font-{weight} */} Equipment

    {/* negative margin: pulls the element towards the previous element. Where margin pushes away, this pulls it closer to it*/} {s0.map((skill) =>(
